intro: Ficinia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered figwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pale purple. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Ficinia minutiflora plays a role in supporting local pollinators due to its nectar-rich flowers.
